intro: Leucheria divaricata, commonly known as the variable leucheria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
